item.title: Wildy/Safe Zone
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“The_Forgottn, post:3, topic:131464”]Well explained, thanks.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 08, 2007, 08:18:40 AM[/size][hr]Hmm, I did that, and got 100 errors…

Here’s my code:

public boolean nonWild() {
if ((absY >= 0) && (absY <= 3712))
heightLevel == 1);
return true;
else
return false;

[/quote]
You did not follow what I said. Change that to this:

public boolean nonWild() {
if (((absY >= 0) && (absY <= 3712)) ||
heightLevel == 1);
return true;
else
return false;
}

Read full topic

item.title: Wildy/Safe Zone
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Open up Client.JAVA and search for

public boolean nonWild() {

Once you find that, now after the first || add this:

((absY > 0) && (absY < 3712)) ||

Now the 3712 should be the number of the Y coordinate where the wilderness starts. If this is not it, feel free to walk up to Varrock Level 1 Multi Wild, and just before you enter the Wilderness, stop and use the Y-Coordinate that you’re standing on. That should work, and now everything should be safe zone except for the wilderness.

Remember to save, compile, and then run the server to put any changes you made to your .JAVA files to effect.

Simple.

Read full topic
